column5: It all started when my dad came home from work a bit early. I asked him to head out knowing I wouldn't have much time on the water. We got down to the river to see all the ice and snow melted and the water a bit too off color for my liking. We walked to the pool and every minute that went by it would get darker and darker I committed 3/4 my time to pink worms. With no success and our time coming to an end I tied on a pink/ purple jig. A few cast in a tree clamed my hole setup. I retied and put on a hot pink jig 2 drifts in I say to my dad its getting late... Shortly after my float drops and I set into this nice fish. caught it on a jig I tied last night it really made my day. Shortly after releasing the fish we left.
Nice Bow Sil. Must feel awesome on something you tied yourself..You killed me today when you said you were going out !!... I can't work under these conditions
nice fish, good job on landing fish on self made jig. 2nd picture is awsome
Great report and pics silvio  Awesome, great job Thanks for sharing Leechman
Like winning first prize at the county fair with your home baked bread.  Maybe not, but I always wanted to do that anyway.  Nice feesh.
There's no better feeling mang..   Quite the accomplishment when you think about it!!  Right on.  cheers HD
Thanks guys.
Nothing more satisfying than succeeding with a product fashioned  by your own hands.
Good job bud with the short time you had. Nice work on those jigs, thats a really nice bow.  Berge
Hopefully well bags some this weekend.
I might have to borrow a jig from you   . you tie them great, should be selling them.
I second that  Nothing beats a wild fish, either. Good job!  p.-
Thanks Paul maybe next time things will work out and we can meet up.
I posted in the classifieds I have allot of time on my hands.

Question for you guys out there who fish jigs.  Have you ever noticed that a large majority of fish that hit pink jigs are male steelhead and majority of fish off white jigs are female??  This is a pattern that I have been noticing for the last few years.  Maybe its just a weird coincidence.
I am going to look into this seems very interesting.
nice fish man!
Nice fish Sil!!!  I hit the Notty yesterday for an hour or 2 and came up with nada!
Same with Black.    I tend to catch a lot more males with black jigs and buggers.
Lol Bill next year all show you the lower notty. Wish I spent more time fishing it this year.
I think I am going to cut my losses and hit the lower the next time I go out!

The lower is extremely hit or miss... Its very big water with nothing to stop these fish from migrating upstream but its worth a try. My buddy who lives up there is going to pm me with what the northern tribs are like he's been doing well up there. I might make the trip up this weekend if time allows me too.
